unnormalised: Someone asked me about what all IDs are needed when applying for jobs in India, so thought I'd share my experience. You'll def need your Aadhar no. (something like 1234-5678-9012) handy, as most companies now use it for background checks and stuff. I remember one company even asked for my PAN (ABCDE1234F) right at the start, which felt a bit much, but apparently it's standard practice these days. Your school and college IDs are also good to keep around, just in case they ask for verification during the interview or onboarding.
normalised: Someone asked me about what all I D s are needed when applying for jobs in India, so thought I'd share my experience. You'll definitely need your Aadhar number (something like one thousand two hundred and thirty four dash five thousand six hundred and seventy eight dash nine thousand and twelve) handy, as most companies now use it for background checks and stuff. I remember one company even asked for my P-A-N (A B C D E one two three four F) right at the start, which felt a bit much, but apparently it's standard practice these days. Your school and college I D s are also good to keep around, just in case they ask for verification during the interview or onboarding.

unnormalised: Apart from the usual government-issued IDs, companies often want to see your employment history, so keep your previous company ID cards and employee numbers safe! One time, I completely forgot my emp ID from my first job and had to call HR to dig it out; saved by the bell, that was. Also, for higher education, your roll no. (like something/2015/CS/045) is useful. Some recruiters may also ask for proof of address, so either use your driving license or some utility bill registered to your name.

unnormalised: Ultimately, it's always better to be over-prepared than under-prepared when it comes to ID proofs. Keep photocopies of all your important docs, like your voter ID (XYZ1234567), and maybe even a digital copy saved on your phone or in the cloud. Good luck with the job hunt, and hope this helps!
